text: Arturo Acevedo Vallarino (1873-1950) was a Colombian film director known for the silent films La tragedia del silencio (1924) and Bajo el Cielo Antioqueño (1925). In order to buy his first movie camera, he sold a timber plantation. In 1920, he founded production company Acevedo e Hijos. Arturo spent his childhood in Zipaquirá with his father, General Ramón Acevedo. He married Laura Mendez Bernal and had six children. ==References== ==External links== * Category:Colombian film directors Category:People from Bogotá Category:People from Cundinamarca Department Category:1873 births Category:1950 deaths
